p: The total protein concentration fluctuated during the experimental trials ( Figure 4 and Supplementary Table S1). According to the temperature rise, the protein levels followed an increasing ( p < 0.05) trend until 21 °C (plus 45–60%) under all experimental conditions. Compared to CD, higher ( p < 0.05) values were found at 21 °C in fish fed on D200 diet and, especially, D100. Temperature shifts from 21 to 25 °C caused a significant decrease ( p < 0.05) of total protein in fish fed on CD (minus 20%), and to a lesser extent D100 and D200 groups (minus 8 and 4%, respectively). No significant differences ( p > 0.05) were observed for the protein levels between fish fed on 100 and 200 ppm diets at 25 °C.
